markdownRemark.html:
There’s a growing consciousness about the failure and myth of the academic system.

Sure, it has worked for a few decades. But today, could someone honestly say that having a degree ensures a fulfilling well-paying job/career?

I happened to catch a morning radio show the other day. And their topic was “I hold a degree from a top school but my pay is s**t”. The callers, they had stories very close to mine. 10 years or so of being employees, earning 30k-40k a month. Enough to live by, but never going to get them anywhere near achieving financial freedom.

Alumni of UP, Ateneo, La Salle… Engineers, teachers, accountants, doctors… Some have graduate degrees even!

One of the DJs joked that his co-host earns four times their monthly salaries, hosting wedding receptions for 2 hours! Four times an engineer’s salary making people play musical chairs!

We were led to believe that going to school was the only way to have a successful life. You had to have a diploma or you’re deemed as a failure!

And it has produced a culture of resignation.

“Di kasi ako Atenista.”

“Di ako nakatapos kaya hanggang dito na lang ako.”

“Hayskul lang inabot ko e.”

You don’t finish school, and you’re suddenly out of options.

That has got to change.
